sect3.title: Program Files
sect3.para: gunzip (link to gzip), gzexe, gzip, uncompress (link to gunzip), zcat (link to gzip), zcmp, zdiff, zforce, zgrep, zmore and znew

sect4.title: gunzip, uncompress
sect4.para: gunzip and uncompress decompress files which are compressed with gzip.

sect4.title: gzexe
sect4.para: gzexe allows you to compress executables in place and have them automatically uncompress and execute when they are run (at a penalty in performance).

sect4.title: gzip
sect4.para: gzip reduces the size of the named files using Lempel-Ziv coding (LZ77).

sect4.title: zcat
sect4.para: zcat uncompresses either a list of files on the command line or its standard input and writes the uncompressed data on standard output

sect4.title: zcmp
sect4.para: zcmp invokes the cmp program on compressed files.

sect4.title: zdiff
sect4.para: zdiff invokes the diff program on compressed files.

sect4.title: zforce
sect4.para: zforce forces a .gz extension on all gzip files so that gzip will not compress them twice. This can be useful for files with names truncated after a file transfer.

sect4.title: zgrep
sect4.para: zgrep invokes the grep program on compressed files.

sect4.title: zmore
sect4.para: zmore is a filter which allows examination of compressed or plain text files one screen at a time on a soft-copy terminal (similar to the more program).

sect4.title: znew
sect4.para: znew re-compresses files from .Z (compress) format to .gz (gzip) format.
